column2: Cuba is not of our concern
Syndicalism in Cuba

Despite Cuba being under reactionary dictatorships for several decades, a latent syndicalist movement exists there, centered around young figures such as Fidel Castro and Camilo Cienfuegos. They have asked for our support on training a revoluctionary cell which, they dream, will one day be able to bring their island towards the family of socialist nations.
Full aid shall be given
column9: Гарантировать независимость Тайваня и отправить военных советников

column2: We have no interest in Cuba
Protests in Havana
Trade unions have announced a general strike today, as the workers of Cuba demand democratic reforms in our country.
This is weird...
Protests are growing
Pro-democracy protests in Cuba are getting more dangerous, as their numbers increase. The masses are gathering nearer and nearer our presidential palace in Havana.
Let's see what happens then
Send the army to disperse the crowd
The people surround El Capitolio
El Capitolio, our presidential palace in Havana, has been surrounded by the masses! They demand democratic reforms in Cuba!
Listen to their demands - Democracy for Cuba!
The Army takes control of the streets in Havana!
Massacre in Havana!

A presidential order has sent the Cuban Army towards the protesters who were gathering in downtown Havana. A predictable massacre ensued, leaving fifty men and women dead. Our people are outraged! And this will only serve to fuel dissent against our government even more...
This action was needed to ensure our safety
Attack on Fort Moncada

The Army attack on unarmed protesters in Havana only served to fuel dissent against the State and give more sympatizers to the syndicalist cause. This morning, a foreign-sponsored band of socialist bandits has begun an attack on the Moncada Barracks, in Santiago de Cuba! This large fort houses a large number of small arms, which would surelly be put into good use by their cause...
No pasarбn! They shall not pass!
Battle of Moncada - Government victory!

The rebel group under the command of brothers Fidel and Raъl Castro has been defeated as they attempted to break through the arsenal at Fort Moncada. Of the two-hundred men involved on the attack, 61 were killed in the fighting, with circa fifty being captured. One hundred more managed to flee across the countryside, however. Amongst the detainees is the young lawyer Fidel Castro, one of the masterminds of this insurgency.
Told you they wouldn't pass!
Battle of Moncada - Rebel victory!

The rebel group under the command of brothers Fidel and Raъl Castro has succeded in their attack against Fort Moncada. They managed to break through the base's arsenal and stole a huge cache of arms and ammunition, which they will use against us!
This is not good...
Show trials

The government of Cuba is setting up 'special tribunals' to deal with the captured rebels of the failed attack at Fort Moncada. As socialist leaders Camilo Cienfuegos and Raъl Castro are hiding in the mountains, the star of these show trials will be the third in command, Fidel Castro.
Proceed
The judgment of Fidel Castro

The show trials of the captured syndicalist rebels is coming to an end. With many low-level operatives being condemned to long terms in prison or exile abroad, the jury is expected to deliver today the sentence to Fidel Castro.
Al paredуn! Execute him by firing squad!
Exile this bastard
'History will absolve me'

'I do not fear death, as I do not fear the fury of the miserable tyrant who took the lives of my comrades. Condemn me. It doesn't matter. History will absolve me.' - Excerpt from Fidel Castro's final defense before his execution
Just shoot him already!
Cuban exiles

Socialist leaders Camilo Cienfuegos and Raъl Castro, together with a party of fifty other revolutionaries, have arrived today in Miami, Florida, having spent several months hiding in the Cuban mountains after their failed attack at Fort Moncada. They have oficially asked for political asylum, and plan on maintaining contact with the remaining syndicalist cells in their home country from here.
Grant them asylum, of course
Send them somewhere else
Cuban exiles

Socialist leaders Camilo Cienfuegos and Raъl Castro, together with a party of fifty other revolutionaries, have arrived today in Belize City, having spent several months hiding in the Cuban mountains after their failed attack at Fort Moncada. They have oficially asked for political asylum, and plan on maintaining contact with the remaining syndicalist cells in their home country from here.
Grant them asylum, of course
Send them somewhere else
Cuban exiles

Socialist leaders Camilo Cienfuegos and Raъl Castro, together with a party of fifty other revolutionaries, have arrived today in Cancъn, having spent several months hiding in the Cuban mountains after their failed attack at Fort Moncada. They have oficially asked for political asylum, and plan on maintaining contact with the remaining syndicalist cells in their home country from here.
Grant them asylum, of course
Send them somewhere else
Conference with Cuban socialists

After some years operating in our country, Cuban socialist leaders Camilo Cienfuegos and Raъl Castro have approached us. According to them, the Cuban exilee community in the CSA, together with the remaining socialist cells in the island, are ready to launch another atempt at an uprising!
Give them whatever they need!
Not of our concern, sorry
Conference with Cuban socialists

After some years operating in our country, Cuban socialist leaders Camilo Cienfuegos and Raъl Castro have approached us. According to them, the Cuban exilee community in Mexico, together with the remaining socialist cells in the island, are ready to launch another atempt at an uprising!
Give them whatever they need!
Not of our concern, sorry
Conference with Cuban socialists

After some years operating in our country, Cuban socialist leaders Camilo Cienfuegos and Raъl Castro have approached us. According to them, the Cuban exilee community in Centroamerica, together with the remaining socialist cells in the island, are ready to launch another atempt at an uprising!
Give them whatever they need!
Not of our concern, sorry
Incident at the Baнa de los Cocinos

This morning, a yatch sailing under a neutral flag docked in the Baнa de los Cocinos (Bay of Pigs) without authorization from our customs or naval authorities. A Navy patrol boat sent to the scene was greeted with shots, leaving two seaman dead. According to later intelligence reports, the yatch was carrying exiled syndicalist leaders Camilo Cienfuegos and Raъl Castro, plus some fifty other rebels. The group is now gone...
What the hell is this?
Revolution!

Castro and Cienfuegos have contacted other socialist groups in the major cities of Cuba. Together, they have began to launch a left-wing Revolution in Cuba! They demand the resignation of our government, or we will face the wrath of the people!
Let them come if they dare
We can't afford a civil war, resign now
The Battle of Santiago de Cuba
One of our army divisions has encountered a major rebel unit in the outskirts of Santiago de Cuba!
We are ready for war!
Battle of Santiago - Government Victory!

We have managed to defeat the rebel army in this battle, thus aborting the socialist revolt before it reached most of our territory. We will surelly spend the next months wipping some minor guerillas in the countryside, but any major uprising against our rule is now out of question!
We prevail!
Battle of Santiago - Rebel Victory!
The rebel guerillas have defeated us! Our army must now retreat west and regroup for a new offensive.
So embarassing!
The Battle of Santa Clara
After regrouping, our army is ready for a new offensive against the socialist guerillas in the Sierra Maestra region. If we fail, the road to Havana will be open!
Attack!
Battle of Santa Clara - Government Victory!

We have managed to defeat the rebel army in this battle, thus aborting the socialist revolt before it reached the rest of our territory. We will surelly spend the next months wipping some minor guerillas in the countryside, but any continuing uprising against our rule is now out of question!
We prevail!
Battle of Santa Clara - Rebel Victory!

The rebel bands have managed to defeat us! Despite our fierce fighting, our ranks were weakened by deserting soldiers, many who proceeded to join the enemy. Now the path is clear for the rebel's final run towards our capital...
Now pray to heavens...
Socialist units enter Havana!
After a short civil war, the rebel units under Raъl Castro and Camilo Cienfuegos have entered La Habana! Under greetings from the people, they have assumed power!
Run! Run to the hills!
Castro and Cienfuegos form a new cabinet
With approval of the people, the rebel leaders have setup a new syndicalist government for Cuba!
Great!

The Panama Disease is killing the Banana Crop

Honduras, the leading Banana exporter has been struck by whats being called 'The Panama Disease'. It is a fungus attacks the roots of the banana plant and kills it, and without our Banana exports we're nothing. The Communards are licking their chops, waiting for an economic crisis to seize power. We've got to find a way to stop this outbreak before Bananas aren't the only thing dying in masses. We can try to invest in a new crop, use more fungicide or develop new Cultivars, or other species of the Banana.
Order the farmers to grow new crops!
Fungicide will kill this disease
Develop new Cultivars that are immune to the fungus
column9: Разработать новые сорта, которые имеют иммунитет к грибку

column2: The Panama Disease is Immune to Fungicide
column9: Панамская болезнь имеет иммунитет к фунгицидам

column2: After the outbreak of the Panama Disease, we tried to use fungicides to get rid of the outbreak, but the fungus seems to be immune.
column9: После вспышки панамской болезни мы попытались использовать фунгициды, чтобы избавиться от нее, но грибок, кажется, имеет к ним иммунитет.

column2: Well, theres nothing we can do now...
column9: Ну, мы ничего не можем сделать сейчас...

column2: Order the farmers to grow new crops!
The New Cultivars aren't Immune
After the outbreak of the Panama Disease, we tried to invent new Cultivars that were immune to the fungus, but they too have been struck.
column9: После вспышки панамской болезни мы попытались создать новые сорта, которые имеют иммунитет к грибку, но и они были поражены.

column2: Well, theres nothing we can do now...
column9: Ну, мы ничего не можем сделать сейчас...

column2: Order the farmers to grow new crops!
The New Economy of Honduras

After the outbreak of the Panama disease, we forced the farmers to grow new crops, it was a tough choice but it seems the only way to keep the economy from collapsing. The transition will be slow, but the Panama Disease is an unsolveable problem.
column9: После вспышки панамской болезни мы заставили фермеров выращивать новые культуры, это был тяжелый выбор, но единственный, способный спасти экономику от коллапса. Переход к новым культурам будет медленным, но панамская болезнь так и осталась неразрешимой проблемой.

column2: It will be a slow transition, but Honduras will endure!
column9: Это будет медленный переход, но мы будем терпеть!

column2: The Farmers of Honduras are Oppressed

After the outbreak of the Panama disease in Honduras, the government began telling the farmers what to grow, how much to grow and where to grow it. Centroamerica will not stand for such injustices against the farmers and the peasants, what course of action shall we take?
Begin funding and training left-wing dissidents
column9: Начать финансирование и обучение левых диссидентов

column2: Begin funding and training left-wing dissidents
column9: Начать финансирование и обучение левых диссидентов

column2: We must build Syndicalism further at home first
column9: Сперва мы должны укрепить синдикализм у себя дома

This will not be the first Left-Wing uprising we have crushed!

Send the Tegucigalpa Garrison to the Valley
They will make due with what they have!

Northwest Honduras has been purged of the Rebels!
Northwest Honduras has been taken by the Guerrilas

Siege the mountains before clearing them out

column2: Siege the mountains before clearing them out
column9: Провести осаду гор перед их зачисткой

column2: We must rush in to clear the mountains before they are fortified!
column9: Мы должны очистить горы от повстанцев раньше, чем они создадут укрепления!

column2: The Battle of Copan
We have caught them off guard, it is only a matter of time
column9: Мы застали их врасплох, их поражение - вопрос времени

column2: The Rebels wont budge, the plan isn't working!
column9: Повстанцы удерживают свои позиции, план не сработал!

column2: The Battle of Copan
The rebels are routing! Chase them back into Centroamerica!
column9: Повстанцы разгромленны! Выгнать их назад в Центроамерику!

column2: The Rebels have fortified, the operation has failed
The Battle of Copan takes a turn for the worst
This is going to be a long siege...
We must overwhelm them, continue sending infantry
column9: Мы должны сокрушить их, пусть пехота продолжает штурм

column2: The Siege of the Copan Mountains
The Rebels have been driven from the mountains!
The Rebels have been driven from the mountains!
The Rebels have regrouped and launched a counter-offensive

The Rebels have been driven from the mountains!
The Rebels have been driven from the mountains!

The Civil War is Over
Honduras has prevailed!
Honduras Syndicalists lost civil war

We have lost our chance to subvertly install Syndicalist government in Honduras as government troops are overcoming rebels, sponsored by us. Now we must decide if we want to ignite war or stay peaceful.
We shall liberate workers of Honduras!
We shall liberate workers of Honduras!
We are not prepared for another front to fight on
The Battle of Comoyagua
If we dont make a stand at Comoyagua, Tegucigalpa will fall
column9: Если мы не удержим Комаягуа, Тегусигальпа падет

column2: The Outcome of Comoyagua
Comoyagua is lost! The rebels will soon attack Tegucigalpa!
column9: Город потерян! Повстанцы готовятся к штурму Тегусигальпы!

column2: Comoyagua has been held, push them back!
column9: Город устоял, мы готовы уничтожить остатки повстанцев!

column2: The Siege of Tegucigalpa
The Rebels have taken the capital! The army surrenders!
The rebels are defeated, push them back!
The Rebels Overrun Tegucigalpa
The Power is in the hands of the people! Socialism prevails!
The Rebels have won the Civil War
The Guerillas we have funded, supplied and armed have overrun the government and have begun the transformation into a Syndicalist state.
We will oversee Honduras' transformation
Integrate them!
Honduras and Centroamerica at War!
We must decide if we can wage a war to contain aggressive tendencies of Centroamerica. Today Honduras, tomorrow us ?
We will crush Centroamerica!
We aren't ready to attack Centroamerica!
Mexico and Centroamerica at War!
column9: Мексика и Центроамерика в состоянии войны!

column2: Mexico has gone to war with Centroamerica, this may be a good chance to destroy Centroamerica and liberate Honduras from the Communard bastards.

column2: We must destroy Centroamerica!
Let Mexico and Centroamerica fight it out
column9: Пусть Мексика и Центроамерика воюют без нас

column2: The Question of Honduras
Now that we control Honduras, what should we do?
column9: Теперь, когда мы контролируем территорию Гондураса, мы должны выбрать, как с ней поступить

column9: Включить Гондурас в состав Соединенных Провинций

column2: Liberate Honduras!
The United Provinces Victory in the Central American War
The United Provinces have emerged victorious in the Central American War! We know control all of Central America, either directly or indirectly.
column9: Мы вышли победителями в центральноамериканской войне! В настоящий момент мы контролируем весь регион, вновь объединив его в одно государство!

column2: Central America is Ours!
The United Provinces have fallen
We have defeated the United Provinces. Now, nothing stands in our way!
column9: Мы победили Соединенные Провинции и сейчас ничто не стоит на нашем пути!

column2: It is only a matter of time until all of Central America is ours!
column9: Это только вопрос времени, когда мы объединим Центральную Америку!

column2: Panama has fallen to the Centroamerican Army
Panama has fallen to our army, the Centroamerican flag flies over Panama City!
column9: Панама пала под натиском нашей армии, центроамериканский флаг развевается над ее поверженной столицей!

column2: The Centroamerican flag flies over Panama City!
The Honduras Civil War

The syndicalists of Centroamerica have used our desperate measures following the Panama disease to gain followers among our peasantry. Now the country is in state of full rebellion and, unless we want to be thrown out of power, we must act eact quickly.
column9: Синдикалисты Центроамерики воспользовались нашими отчаянными мерами по спасению урожаев от панамской болезни и получили поддержку среди наших крестьян. Сейчас страна находится в состоянии гражданской войны и мы должны действовать быстро, если хотим сохранить свою власть.

column2: This will not be the first Left-Wing uprising we have crushed!
column9: Это не первое левое восстание, которое мы утопим в крови!

column2: We're tired of the blood shed, its not worth it, we go without a fight
column9: Мы устали от кровопролития, передать им власть

column2: The Virreinato Manifesto
Now we have an ideological basis!
column9: Теперь у нас есть идеологические принципы!

column2: Black Monday reaches Buenos Aires

The effects of the Berlin stock exchange crash have arrived in La Plata. Germany and her satellites are our largest economic partners - with their markets closed due to this crisis, our industry will suffer greatly... Already many factories are reducing production and sending off their employees.
Really?
Industrial Recovery Plan

Our Ministry of Industry has come up with a plan to recover part of our industrial output. By granting huge loans to our industrialists, part of our factories will return to work. Meanwhile, our exports will be directed towards other, unnafected markets.
column9: Наш министр промышленности предложил план по восстановлению экономики. Предоставив большие кредиты промышленникам, мы вернем часть фабрик к работе. Между тем, мы направим часть экспорта на новые рынки.

column2: La Plata will be the first country out of this crisis
column9: Ла-Плата будет первой страной, вышедшей из кризиса

column2: The invisible hand of capitalism will take care of this
column9: Невидимая рука капитализма позаботится об этом

column2: Terrorist Attack in Montevideo!

Tragedy has struck our Uruguayan Republic as a bomb exploded in a police station in downtown Montevideo, killing 5 policemen and 4 civilians and injuring dozens others. Intelligence data reports that this may be an act of an anti-Platinean separatist group!
Investigate the separatist groups
column9: Начать расследование в отношение сепаратистских группировок

column2: Announce a police investigation
Uruguayan separatist group uncovered

Our security services have uncovered a terrorist group in Rivera, on the Uruguay-Brazil border, who is believed to be linked to the January attack in Montevideo. The twelve men and women will be charged for multiple murders, conspiracy and high treason!
column9: Наши спецслужбы обнаружили террористическую группировку в Ривере, в Уругвае, на границе с Бразилией, которые, как считаются, связаны с январским взрывом в Монтевидео. Двенадцать мужчин и женщин будут осуждены за убийства, заговор и измену!

column2: Good!
A Plan for Agriculture

The large cattle and grains farms of Argentina form a cornerstone of Platinean economy. However, they still haven't fully recovered from the effects of the Berlin Crisis. Our Ministry of Agriculture has developed a plan to increase food output all over the country.
Support this initiative
We don't have funds for that, sorry
Form a National Guard?

The current crackdown campaing on separatist groups in Paraguay and Uruguay has come to an end. In all, over two hundred extremists have been arrested. Reports from our security services suggest, however, establishing a permanent paramilitary force to deal specifically with these groups.
Establish it
That is not needed
Citizenship Act

As Ramуn Castillo's attempt at a provisional government couldn't even control the vicinity of the Casa Rosada itself, generals Pedro Pablo Ramirez and Edelmiro Farrel marched with their garrisons towards the Plaza de Mayo. Under the excuse of 'preventing an syndicalist uprising by any means necessary', the rioters were brutally stopped and Castillo's cabinet was deposed. Move along, nothing to see here
A conspiracy has been discovered!

After a long session using 'special interrogation techniques', our police has extracted important information from Ramуn Mercader: namely, he confessed to be a part of a conspiracy aimed to kill Emiliano Zapata and install a new government in Mexico. Surprisingly, the head of this scheme is noted general and commited socialist, Plutarco Elнas Calles!
Psssht! Don't let anyone hear this! These rumours end now!
Arrest Calles and all those involved in this conspiracy!
Presidential Elections, 1936

The 1936 presidential elections have begun today. The many factions of the hegemonic Party of the Mexican Revolution (PRM), from the mainstream Villistas and Zapatistas to the anarchist Magonistas, the Social-Democrats and even the fringe Totalists, have all fielded their own candidates. Challenges for our next president range from internal political opposition to instability in the USA across the Rio Grande.
Pancho Villa will keep the revolutionary ideals alive
Plutarco Elнas Calles, the hardline general
Lazaro Cardenas, the middle-ground moderate
Economical expansion in Mexico

Now that the transition of power is over, we must decide on a new series of economical expansions. Should we continue Zapata's policies of land reform and industrialization? Some generals believe instead that we could help our economy through the expansion of our armed forces.
Expand the military, we must regain our lost territories
We need a modern industrial base
The demand in the world for agriculture is great
The State of the Military
As we decided to heat up our economy through military expansion, different sectors of our armed forces favour different paths for expansion.
Infantry - Battles are won on the ground through numbers
Cavalry - Speed and manuverability are essential to victory
A Fighter Squadron, we shouldn't underestimate air power
A Navy! Nothing wrong with having a Navy... What?
New agriculture policies

The new government has announced its new top priority: the expansion of Zapata's famed land reform programme. Not only we will continue the expropriation of the large haciendas, but we must give new directions to the ejidos: should they continue prioritizing production for the internal market, or should we focus on crops for exporting?
Mexico will become the new granary of the world
We must feed and maintain our own growing population
New industrial policies
As part of a new industrial expansion plan, the government must decide between expanding our manufacturing capacity or exploiting natural resources
Factories, we need a greater industrial output
Natural resources, expand mining facilities
The Oil Industry

Oil here in Mexico is abundant, yet most of our people still use lumber to keep their ovens running. The foreign oil companies in Mexico have had it too good for too long, and we should have nationalized the industry long ago. This would be a big step into becoming more than everyone else's piсata, so to speak.
Storm the rigs! They belong to Mexico!
Nationalizing them would be a dangerous political move
Spanish immigrants arrive in Mexico

To escape the civil war ravaging the Iberian Peninsula, immigrants have fled to Latin America. Thousands and their families have recently arrived in Mexico by boat and are looking for work, food and a place to live. We can either bar them entrance from the country, or allow them a place here.
Welcome them with open arms
Bah, send them back to Spain
El Presidente and the Totalist ideology
Officially subscribe to Totalism
There is no need for that, really
A Totalist land reform

Our president has decided to take a closer look on the land reform programmes initiated by Emiliano Zapata. Although they have brought many important results, he believes that handing too much power to the peasants has led to major inneficiency for the ejidos. Some ministers have now proposed that the ejidos must face state intervention and that all agricultural production must be directed by the state itself.
Enforce direct state control over the ejidos
The system is working, why bother?
A Totalist dictatorship?

As president Calles has officially endorsed the Totalist ideology, his authoritarian desires have become more explicit. According to his closer advisors, he plans to officialy dissolve the Mexican Constitution of 1917, dissolve the Senate and concentrate all political power of Mexico in his hands! This 'Maximato', according to him, would be a new form of government, ensuring the proper application of socialist policies for the good of Mexico.
Establish the Maximato, our Dictatorship of the Proletariat
This is just too much
The status of the Ejidos
Our president has come up with a proposal for political reform. If we grant more power to the ejidos and local village communes, we may manage our economical resources more efficiently!
Grant political power to the ejidos and local neighborhood councils
The system is good as it is, why change it?
The anti-clerical policies of Mexico

Our president is a known militant atheist and an opponent of the Catholic Church. Over the past months, he and his close advisors have begun to move to enforce the anti-clerical articles of the Mexican Constitution of 1917 - including provisions such as depriving the Church of its property rights and depriving the clergy of a number of civil liberties. Should we put these policies in motion?
Yes, begin persecution of the Catholic Church
No, we'd gain nothing by upseting the Church
Catholic unrest
They already had enough, suspend further persecution
Keep up the anti-clerical campaign
The Cristero Uprising begins

The anti-catholic persecution of our president has caused a number of rebellions in Central Mexico. Local peasants, aided by conservative politicians and the remainders of the Catholic hierarchy, have taken up arms! Rallying under the banner of the Cristo Rey and Nuestra Seсora de Guadalupe, these bandits have pledged to defend their right to practice their faith!
To arms!
Catholic uprising in Mexico

The anti-catholic persecution undertaken by Mexico's socialist president has reached such outrageous results that tens of thousands of peasants have taken up arms against the government! Aided by the remnants of the old elites and local priests, these rebels are rallying under the banners of El Cristo Rey and Nuestra Seсora de Guadaloupe and pledged to defend their faith! Some members of our foreign service have proposed that we send supplies and volunteers to help this rebellion.
Support them, send supplies and volunteers
We should not get involved
Italian involvement in La Cristiada

The Papist government of Italy has lent their support to the Catholic uprising in Central Mexico. Hundreds of their military advisors and a good cache of arms have arrived to the rebel-held lands. We can't tolerate their meddling in our internal affairs!
Damn them!
The end of the Cristero Uprising

The Mexican Army, after a tough fight, has managed to defeat the Cristero Uprising, also known as La Cristiada. At last, Mexico is free from the perfidious influence of the Catholic Church! We can now continue our reforms and keep up with our project of transforming the country into a respected atheist republic.
At last, establish official state atheism
This persecution ends here
A new educational system

The expropriation of the Church-run schools and universities and their replacement by a secular curriculum has made its first fruits. By purging our universities from the clergy's influences, the performance of our researchers has increased!
Amazing!
Catholic resistance

Despite our great efforts to rid Mexico of its reactionary remnants, namely the Catholic Church, their resistance is tenacious. Clandestine pamphlets have been circulating across the country, calling for priests and laypeople to resist the anti-clerical laws of our republic!
Oh, well...
The fate of the Zapatista land reform

Our military junta has consolidated its control of Mexico, thanks to a huge support of the conservative bourgeoisie. Now, in order to appease these classes, we must work to dissolve many of the Zapatista institutions and socialist policies - a good place to start would be scrapping the land reform programmes and returning most of the lands to their former owners, the grand hacienderos. What path will we take?
Dissolve the ejidos and return the land to the hacienderos
We must slowly revert the land reform programme
The current system works fine, do nothing
Peasant resistance
All across Mexico, peasants are rebelling against our efforts to dissolve the ejidos! Damn they!
Oh, well...
Economical reforms

As we continue to destroy the socialist institutions, we must reform our economical policies. Should we take a laissez-faire approach as the Mexican elites propose and let the free hand of capitalism do her work? Or maybe it would be better if the state were to maintain a certain ammount of control over the economy - a dirigist approach?
Adopt free market policies
The state must intervene when necessary
Privatization of major industries

After we decided to follow a free-market approach to our economy, our Ministry of Industry has produced a report on a number of state-owned industries that should be privatized. After all, the private initiative would do a better job keeping them running than some bureaucrat in Mexico City, right? Some withing our government, however, believe that the state must retain ownership of certain key industries...
Begin to privatize all state-owned industry
Some strategic sectors should be kept under state control
The state must retain great control over the economy
Military reforms in Mexico

Mexico is now under a military government - thus, of course, it is expected that the junta will give much-needed attention to the armed forces of our country. Mexico is surroundered by potential enemies, from the syndicalists in Centroamerica to the unstable USA to our north - if we want to survive, we must be prepared to defend la pбtria!
Favour expansion of our infantry troops, the backbone of our army
Expand the cavalry corps, we must outmaneuver our enemies
Invest in an air force, you can never underestimate air superiority
A Navy is most important, nothing wrong with having a Navy... What?
Reclaiming our lost territories

In 1848, as a result of our defeat in the Mexican-American War, we were forced to cede nearly half of our territory to the United States as per the provisions of the Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo. The reversion of this treaty has been a dream for the Mexican people since then. Now, with the USA at war, this could be our chance to regain our lost lands and reassert Mexican control north of the Rio Grande, from California all the way to Texas!
Demand the return of our territories
We can't afford direct conflict, just stake our claims
Are you mad? This is too dangerous!
Mexican territorial demands
The Mexican Republic has decided to use the ongoing American Civil War as an opportunity to reclaim the territories they lost to us due to the 1848 Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo! How should we react?
Secede disputed territory, we can't afford another front
Never! Those lands are American!
The Americans refuse our demands
The foolish leadearship of the United States has refused to accept our rightfull territorial claims. What shall we do now?
War will solve this!
We are not ready for war
The second Mexican-American War

Our refusal to accept the Mexican territorial claims was the last straw. They decided to declare war upon us in order to try to gain those disputed territories by force. Now, troops of the National Guard, together with volunteers from local population, are being mobilized to repell the Mexican assaults!
They must be stoped!
Mexicans occupy Houston, Texas
How could this happen?! The Mexican Army has crossed the whole of Texas and is now occupying the state capital, Houston. Maybe this is our last chance to attempt to end this damn war...
Offer peace treaty, recognize Mexican teritorial gains
No, the war will continue until we march through Mexico City!
Mexicans occupy Santa Fй, New Mexico
We don't know how to say, that, sir... But... The Mexican Army has occupied Santa Fй, the capital of New Mexico. Maybe this is our last chance to attempt to end this war...
Recognize Mexican teritorial gains, we must end this war
No compromise until we are marching on their capital
San Francisco is lost!
Terrible news! The Mexican Army is now controlling our important city of San Francisco, California. We may have no other choice other than recognize our defeat!
Recognize Mexican teritorial gains, we must end this war
No compromise until we are marching on their capital
We have lost much of our territory!

What a disaster! A good portion of the Southwestern USA has been lost to the advancing Mexican Army. With their troops threatening to advance even deeper, this is the time to accept our defeat and cede them the disputed territory.
Accept their claims, we must end this war right now
No compromise until we are marching on their capital
The Treaty of Acapulco

We've succesfully beaten the American army and conquered the disputed border states. Now, their humiliated leadership offers us peace in which they promise to recognize our teritorial gains and withdrawn from disputed teritory. How shall we react ?
Accept proposal, this is more than we expected!
No, no peace until we're marching on Washington!
The Treaty of Acapulco
According to the Treaty of Acapulco, we must cede to Mexico a good part of our territory...
How humiliating!
We're losing the Mexican-American War

The American resistance is being tougher than we tought. Not only we did not achieve any of our major goals so far, but the American army has advanced across the Rio Grande, occupying important cities in the border. We must accept our defeat...
Accept our defeat, propose a peace settlement
No peace until we're marching on Washington
A peace offer from Mexico

Our brave Army and Nationalguardsmen, supplemented with volunteers from local population, succesfully repelled the Mexican assault. Now the humiliated Mexican leadership offers us cease fire, in which they promise to withdrawn all their troops from US soil. How shall we react?
Yes, accept their proposal
No peace until we're marching on Mexico City
The Treaty of Tangamandapio
The Americans have accepted our peace offer. Now we must withdrawn from US soil and reliquish all our territorial claims...

Lost territories back under our control

The americans have accepted our demands and several territories lost in the Treaty of Guadaloupe Hidalgo are now back under our control! These territories, however, are not uninhabited wastelands as they used to be back in 1848: a large and well-armed Anglo population in these states will pose a great threat to the rule of our government and occupying forces.
Well, I wasn't expecting that...
Longists occupy parts of the disputed territory

The ongoing American Civil War, together with our direct intervention against the Federal Government, has allowed the Longist rebels to seize parts of our rightfull lands, such as eastern Tejas! How shall we deal with this violation of our territorial integrity?
Demand their immediate withdrawal from disputed territory !
It is too risky
Mexico demands our withdrawal from Texas

During our ongoing assult, we have managed to capture parts of the state of Texas, which is claimed by Mexico as well. They have issued an official diplomatic demand for our immediate withdrawal from disputed territory. What shall we do?
We must accept their demands, we can't afford another front
Never, Texas will never be Mexican!
American Union state refuses our demands
The foolish leadership of the American Union state refused to withdrawn their troops from our rightful territorry. What shall we do ?
War will solve this !
It is too risky....
We're losing the war against the Longists

The American Union State resistance is being tougher than we tought. Not only we did not achieve any of our major goals so far, but the Longist army has advanced across the Rio Grande, occupying important cities in the border. We must accept our defeat and withdraw from Tejas and other areas of the Deep South.
Accept our defeat, propose a peace settlement
No peace until we're marching on Atlanta
A peace offer from Mexico

Our brave forces have succesfully repelled the Mexican assault. Now the humiliated Mexican leadership offers us cease fire, in which they promise to withdrawn all their troops from AUS soil. How shall we react?
Yes, accept their proposal

The Treaty of Tangamandapio
The Longists have accepted our peace offer. Now we must withdrawn from AUS soil and reliquish our territorial claims do the Deep South...

We're losing the war against Mexico

The Mexican Army is much tougher than we tought. Not only we did not achieve any of our major goals so far, but their army has advanced across the Deep South, occupying important American cities. We must accept our defeat and withdraw from Texas.
Accept our defeat, propose a peace settlement
No peace until we're marching on Mexico City
A peace offer from the American Union State
Our brave forces have succesfully repelled the Longist assaults. Now their leadership offers us cease fire, in which they promise to withdrawn all their troops from disputed Tejas
Yes, accept their proposal
No peace until we're marching on Atlanta
War against the Pacific States?

Another rebel faction of the American Civil War, the Pacific States of America, currently control an area composed of the western seaboard - this includes our rightfull territories of Alta California. We should attack them immediatly!
Attack!
We are tired of conflict already
Victory over the Pacific States

The Mexican army has overcome the armies of the Pacific States of America and are now in a position to demand terms. Some in the government want the whole of California to be returned to Mexico but others feel that aggressive demands will lead to another possible war in the future.
Demand Arizona and all of California
Demand Arizona and the southern half of California
Continue the war, we will crush the PSA
Mexico demands Arizona and all of California
We have been beaten by Mexico in the war and they have demanded Arizona and all of California. The people want to keep resisting but there may be no options left...
We have no choice but to accept
No deal, we fight to the end
Mexico demands Arizona and Southern California
We have been beaten by Mexico in the war and they have demanded Arizona and Southern California. The people want to keep resisting but there may be no options left.
We have no choice but to accept
No deal, fight to the end
The PSA refuses our demands
The PSA has refused to accept our demands and now we must destroy them.
Bastards
The PSA accepts Our Demands
The PSA has seen the wisdom of accepting our demands and we can now look forward to having California back. This is a great day for Mexico.
Excellent
PSA troops occupy Baja California

Troops of the Pacific States have occupied the Baja California peninsula of Mexico! With our troops about to advance deeper into Mexico, maybe this is the perfect opportunity for press claims for a peace settlement to our advantage.
Send the envoys
No peace until we're marching on Mexico City
Peace proposal from the Pacific States

Troops of the Pacific States have occupied the Baja California peninsula of Mexico! With their troops about to advance deeper into Mexico, they have seized the opportunity and sent their envoys to negotiate a peace settlement that is most advantageous to them. Should we accept their claims to Baja California and end the conflict?
Accept their offer
No peace until we're marching on Sacramento
4th of July protests

The 4th of July is the old independence day of the United States of America. The Anglo population in our occupied territories have staged a number of protests, ranging from peaceful gatherings and illegal parades to major protests and acts of vandalism. Obviously, it will take a really, really long time until these gringos accept our rightfull rule over Tejas, Nuevo Mexico and Alta California...
Minor protests occur
Riots occur in major cities
Actions of the Anglo resistance

The resistance of the Anglo population against our occupation forces continues. Once again, terrorist groups operating within the former Southwestern US have staged a number of attacks aimed on crippling our infrastructure, our industrial output and the morale of our forces.
Rebels attack our transport infrastructure
Terrorists destroy a number of important factories
Rebel forces attack our occupying troops
Major Anglo rebellion!
We are under attack! Leaders of the Anglo resistance in the occupied Southwestern US have launched a major coordinated uprising against our troops!
ЎOh! Y ahora, їQuiйn podrб defenderme?
Independence Day

Today is the anniversary of the Mexican declaration of Independence in 1810. All of Mexico is in a festive mood and the grievances of the populace against the government are temporarily forgotten in celebratory swings of tequila!
Donde esta la tequila!?
Mexican settlement in the occupied territories

White americans (Anglos) comprise a majority of the population in the new territories of Alta California, Tejas and Nuevo Mexico. If we ever want to properlly control these lands, we should initiate a programme for settling Mexican nationals there. That would allow us to fully exploit the resources and industrial capacity of these lands in the long run.
Initiate this programme
Nuevo Mexico, Tejas and Alta California under our control

After fifteen years of continuous migration and intensive propaganda efforts, Mexican nationals and Anglos accepting our rule now comprise a convenient portion of the population on the territories of the former Southwestern US. We can now make full use of their resources and industrial capacity.
Great!
Reconquest of our lost territories
Sent an envoy and demand the return of our territories
We must face the facts and recognize the new borders
The Americans demand their lost territories
Accept their demands, we can't hope to win another war

Let them come, we're ready to defend our land
Mexico accepts our demands
The government of Mexico has folded before our might and accepted our demands. Now the former western and southwestern states are back under our control!
Great!
Mexico declines our demands
The government of Mexico has refused to follow our demands and are insisting that the occupied western and southwestern American states are their rightfull territory. We must attack them now!
That's it - Ready the troops and attack
We're not ready for war now - Back down
A proposal from Mexico

The government of Mexico has declined our demands for the return of their occupied American territories. A good part of our government demands that we start a campaign of reconquest at once! But there's still some hope: Mexico has proposed a division of the occupied territories. Leaving American citizens at foreign rule may sound outrageous, but maybe it would be wise to listen to what they have to say.
Alright, listen to what they have to say
We don't want to listen, return the territories now!
The Americans don't want to listen
Those Yankees didn't even want to listen to our offer to divide the disputed territories.
We must accept their demands, unfortunately
Let them come, we're ready to defend our land
A division of the disputed territories

The Americans have agreed to, at least, listen to our proposal about dividing the disputed territories between our two countries. We could press to keep the oil-rich counties of West Texas, or the arid region around El Paso, or at the very least sparselly-populated southern Arizona - the last territory to be ceded by Mexico to the US, in 1853. It is likely that they won't accept any offer that we make, but we must try.
Press for oil-rich West Texas and Southern Arizona
We want the arid Trans-Pecos and Southern Arizona, at least
Try to keep Southern Arizona, the lands of the Gadsden Purchase
Mexico wants West Texas and Southern Arizona

The stubborn Mexicans have made a daring proposal to us: despite our threats, they still insist on keeping Southern Arizona (the lands of the Gadsden Purchase, the last territory transfered from Mexico to the US, back in 1853), plus the heavily populated western part of Texas, including important cities such as Austin, San Antonio and Corpus Christi!
Accept their proposal
They must be crazy, refuse this proposal
Mexico wants Far-West Texas and Southern Arizona
It's just a desert wasteland, let them keep it

PEMEX is founded!
Following our decision to nationalize the oil industry in Mexico, three months ago, all operations have been now combined into one single government-managed company: PEMEX, or Petrуleos Mexicanos.
Isn't this great?
Privatization of Companнa Minera de Cananea

Five months ago, we decided to start a programme to privatize all state-owned industries. The old Companнa Minera de Cananea (Cananea Mining Company) has been sold to its old owner, a consortium led by American entrepeneur Willian Cornell Greene Jr., and reorganized as the Cananea Consolidated Copper Company.
Great news!
New company founded: Grupo Industrial Ramirez

Thanks to our free market economy and pro-business environment, a new industrial conglomerate has been founded in Mexico. Grupo Industrial Ramirez is a new company specialized in producing automobiles and trucks.
Great news!
Ericsson Mexico bought by local investors

A group of Mexican investors has just bought Swedish Ericsson's Mexican branch and renamed the company as Telmex - Telйfonos de Mйxico SAB de CV. This will bring some much-needed expertise in electronics to our country and wouldn't be possible without our pro-market policies!
Great news!
DINA founded

A new automobile manufacturer has been founded in Mexico: DINA, short for Diesel Nacional, is a new producer of heavy duty and specialty trucks, urban buses, armored military vehicles, and intercity buses.
Great news!
The triumph of Mexican muralism
Yes, continue promoting these works of art
We can't afford this, sorry
Syndicalist Centroamerica at war
The socialist federation of Centroamerica are currently in a war against their reactionary neighbours. We must intervene, but how?
Send volunteers to Centroamerica
Propose an alliance between our countries

The government of Socialist Mexico has sent us three volunteer divisions to help in our war against the reactionaries!
Great!
An alliance with Mexico?
The government of Socialist Mexico has proposed us an alliance to help on the fighting against our reactionary enemies. Should we accept?
Sure, forge an alliance for socialism

Centroamerica has accepted
The government of Centroamerica has accepted our proposal and entered an alliance with Mexico!
Great!
War in Central America

Send volunteers to the United Provinces

The government of Mexico has sent us three volunteer divisions to help in our war against the socialists!
Great!
An alliance with Mexico?
The government of Mexico has proposed us an alliance to help on the fighting against our syndicalist enemies. Should we accept?
Sure, forge an alliance against socialism
We can handle this by our own, sorry
The United Provinces have accepted
The government of the United Provices has accepted our proposal and entered an alliance with Mexico!
Great!
The fate of Central America
Following a recent war, we have ended up controlling a good part of Central America. What should we do now?
Restore control to the United Provinces
Restore control to Centroamerica
Partition Central America into minor states
Continue the occupation for now

We have restored the independence of the United Provinces and installed a loyal government there.
Great

Mexico under foreign domination
Our once glorious country has been put under a foreign-imposed puppet government. The people, most obviously, isn't happy about this
Meh.
New allies for the regime

In order to further consolidate our rule, we are pressed to look for new allies among the traditional rulling classes of Mexico. Should we seek renewed support from the rich industralists, or the old aristocratic hacienderos? There's also talk that some within our government would like to seek further support from the Sinarquistas, Mexico's own nationalist and populist movement.
Seek support from the industrialists
The traditional hacienderos will support us
The Sinarquistas are a new force worth reckoning
Keep up the present arrangement
New economic boom

Our Ministry of Economy has announced that the country has entered a new period of economical expansion! No doubt, this has to do with our good relationship with the industrial leaders of Mexico and our mature fiscal environment. This, combined to our tough hand in dealing with trade unions and other destabilizing elements, has allowed our industrial output to increase and our unemployment rates to fall.
Great!
Agricultural expansion

Our Ministry of Economy has announced that a period of increased agricultural output has started in Mexico! Thanks to our good relationship with the hacienderos, the great ranches of Mexico have increased their production of important cash crops such as cotton, coffee and maize.
Great!
Sinarquistas in our cabinet
Oh, interesting!
Roman Catholicism in Mexico
Officially repeal the anti-clerical legislation
We are a modern republic, we will stay a secular state
The Night of the Goldshirts
Openly praise their actions
This is just too much, remove them from our government
The Sinarquistas Attack!

The top leadership of the Uniуn Nacional Sinarquista are at this moment attempting a coup against our government! Hundreds of their Goldshirt militias have surroundered the Palacio Nacional, while rumor has it that army troops sympathetic to their cause are rushing towards Mexico City. They demand the surrender of the current cabinet and their replacement by their own party!
The Sinarquistas succeed and establish a new government
Loyal army troops and the police disperse the Sinarquistas
New economical policies
Our Sinarquista doctrine says that we should attempt intervention on the economy. Shall we proceed, or it would be better if we let the good old invisible hand do its job?
Free market has always been our way, stick to it
Public interference in the economy is needed more than ever
Outlaw the socialist parties?

One of our senators has proposed legislation which outlaws all political organizations the government decides to label as 'socialist'. This would effectively move all serious opposition to our government underground. However, some elements of our cabinet think we should be very cautious now. A persecution of our opposition would alienate the tenuous support we have from the workers and the middle classes.
Sure, get rid of this syndicalist scum
Now is not yet the time
Pontifical University of Mexico founded
Thanks to our repelling of the anti-clerical legislation, the Roman Catholic Church has opened a new university in our country: the Universidad Pontificia de Mйxico!
Oh, great!
A monarchist restoration?
Yes, we must restore the glorious Mexican monarchy
Nonsense - Kings are a thing of the past
Old and new dinasties
Support the claims of Doсa Marнa Anna de Habsburgo-Itъrbide
Choose Don Fernando, the Duke of Moctezuma
The coronation of Doсa Marнa Anna
Long live the Empress!
The coronation of Don Fernando
Long live the King!
Protests against the monarchy
Today, tens of thousands of our working classes and intellectuals have taken the streets to protest against our rule and defend a return to decadent republic. Outrageous!
Minor protests occur
Riots occur in major cities
Potential revolutions

Grand parts of the Caribbean are currently the craddle of major exploitation of the working classes by the local and foreign bourgeoisie. Workers and peasants in places as distant as Cuba, Jamaica and Nicaragua are suffering under famine and poverty, while their bosses profit from their plight. Mexico, as the main socialist power in the region, has the moral duty to assist local syndicalist groups to end this system of exploitation.
We'll do whatever we must to expell imperialism from the Caribbean
We can't upset the major powers of the area
An intervention in Cuba?

Despite Cuba being under reactionary dictatorships for several decades, a latent syndicalist movement exists there. A number of notable Cuban syndicalists, currently in exile in Mexico, have asked for our support on training cadres and revoluctionary cells which, they dream, will one day be able to bring their island towards the family of socialist nations.
Pledge support for the Cuban socialists
We can't afford this
Incident at the Baнa de los Cocinos

This morning, a yatch sailing under a neutral flag docked in the Baнa de los Cocinos (Bay of Pigs) without authorization from our customs or naval authorities. A Navy patrol boat sent to the scene was greeted with shots, leaving two seaman dead. According to later intelligence reports, the yatch was carrying exiled syndicalist leader Julio Antonio Mella, plus some fifty other rebels. The group is now gone...
What the hell was that?
Socialist protesters surround El Capitolio
El Capitolio, our presidential palace in Havana, has been surrounded by the masses! They demand socialist reforms in Cuba!
The protesters invade the palace and establish a socialist regime
The Army takes control of the streets in Havana!
Massacre in Havana!

A presidential order has sent the Cuban Army towards the protesters who were gathering in downtown Havana. A predictable massacre ensued, leaving fifty men and women dead. Our people are outraged! And this will only serve to fuel dissent against our government even more...
This action was needed to ensure our safety
The Cuban government has been overthrown

With a little help from our intelligence services, the socialist vanguard and the working masses of Havana have managed to overthrow the decadent capitalist government of Cuba. A syndicalist regime is now in place.
Great!
Arrange for a cabinet strictly loyal to us
Socialist uprising in Cuba fails

With a little help from our intelligence services, the socialist vanguard and the working masses of Havana have attempted to overthrow the decadent capitalist government of Cuba. Their military, however, acted quickly and foiled our plans...
Damn!
If you want to spread the revolution, you must do it yourself
Socialism in Haiti
We must take the revolution to Hispaniola
We can't afford this
General Strike in Port-Au-Prince

The weak socialist movement of Haiti has managed to conduct a general strike in our capital! Thousands of workers from both the industrial and services sector have joined the protests for higher wages and labour law reforms.
Accept their demands and attempt to foil other protests
Just send in the police already
New protests in our country

The general strike of five days ago was just the beginning of a wave of anti-government protests. Despite our efforts, the movement has only increased in size, as rural workers have joined the protests all over the country. Our very presidential palace in Port-Au-Prince has been surrounded by the people, and there are even rumours that certain sectors of the army and police sympatize with the protesters' cause...
Protesters break the palace's walls and depose the government
Loyal army and police troops disperse the protests
Revolution in Haiti!

With a little help from our intelligence services, the socialist vanguard and the working masses of Haiti have managed to overthrow their decadent capitalist government. A syndicalist regime is now in place.
Great!
Arrange for a cabinet strictly loyal to us
Socialist uprising in Haiti fails

With a little help from our intelligence services, the socialist vanguard and the working masses of Haiti have attempted to overthrow their decadent capitalist government of. Their military, however, acted quickly and foiled our plans...
Damn!
If you want to spread the revolution, you must do it yourself
Socialism in the Dominican Republic
Contact these groups
We can't afford this
A coup in course!

Lately, our security services have learned of the socialist sympathies of some within our Army's officers corps. With the help of foreign agents and fellow travelers with our working classes, these traitor officers have amassed a sizeable military force and are currently en route to our capital Santo Domingo!
The coup is successfull and a syndicalist regime is established
Loyal troops manage to defend the capital from these traitors
Socialist coup d'etat in the Dominican Republic
Our operations in the Dominican Republic have been a success. The socialist vanguard within the Dominican army managed to depose their government and a true, socialist people's regime has emerged.
Great!
Arrange for a cabinet strictly loyal to us
Failed uprising in the Dominican Republic
Despite our help, the left-leaning military officers in the Dominican Republic have failed in their efforts to take power...
Just give up
If you want to spread the revolution, you must do it yourself
Instability in the Caribbean Federation

The Caribbean Federation, a collection of former British colonies in the Caribbean, is the weakest member of the Entente. With their former Canadian masters gone, we have the chance to establish a proper socialist regime there, with the help of the working classes of the islands!
Grant our support to their socialist groups
This is too dangerous
Revolution in the Caribbean

For the past few hours, many of the islands of our Federation have experienced major unrest. Triggered by the fall of the regime in Canada, several clandestine syndicalist groups and trade unions have rallyed the workers to their causes. All across the Federation, government buildings have been occupied by protesters, while the streets have been taken by the masses. The Federal Government in Georgetown seems unable to do anything...
All power to the people! The revolution is a success!
The government rallies loyal troops and disperses the protests
A Caribbean Revolution!

Our efforts have succeeded. The combined forces of workers, peasants and the intelligentsia have managed to overthrow the colonial government of the Caribbean Federation. A socialist government is now being established!
Great!
Arrange for a cabinet strictly loyal to us
Failed uprising in the Caribbean Federation
Despite our help, the left-leaning forces in the Caribbean Federation have failed in their efforts to take power...
Just give up
If you want to spread the revolution, you must do it yourself
Germany and Mexico at war

Mexico, on the other side of the Atlantic Ocean, is one of the oldest socialist countries in the world - and thus a great friend of our Commune. And now, they are under attack from the German Empire. We must offer them our helping hand and invite them to the Internationale to counter this menace.
Invite Mexico into the Internationale
This is not the right time yet
An offer from France
Both France and Mexico, the two oldest socialist states in existence, are currently at war with the German Empire. The government of the Commune has offered an alliance to fight this common enemy.
Accept their offer, of course
We don't want to get involved in European affairs
Mexico accepts our offer
The government of Mexico has accepted our invitation and have joined the Internationale!
Amazing!
Volunteers for Mexico?

Our good friends in Mexico are currently involved in a war. A good number of our citizens and soldiers have asked for permission to join their forces. We should thus organize some volunteer troops and hand command over them to the Mexican military.
Send them the volunteers
We can't allow this to happen
Centroamerican Volunteers
Our good friends in the Centroamerican Federation have raised a volunteer division for the Mexican Army. How kind of them!
Great!
Mexican-American War - French Intervention?

Mexico, on the other side of the Atlantic Ocean, is one of the oldest socialist countries in the world - and thus a great friend of our Commune. And now, they are under attack from the reactionary American forces. We must stand firm in the defense of the Mexican comrades! Should we send the Americans an ultimatum, threatening war if they don't cease their attacks?
Send an ultimatum to the Americans
We can't risk conflict across the Atlantic, sorry
War against Mexico - A threat from the French

As we continue our war against the Mexican agression, we have received a note from the syndicalist leaders of the Commune of France: either we cease our offensive, or we risk a war against the Internationale. They may well be bluffing, but this is a clear threat from a major power.
They must be joking - Continue our offensive
We can't risk it - Accept the French demands
Mexican-American War is over
Our ultimatum has worked. The reactionary army of the Americans has ceased all offensive operations against our Mexican brothers!
Ha! We are invincible!
French intervention in the Mexican-American War
Thanks to a good help of the Commune of France, the Americans have ceased their attack against Mexico. This is a great day for French-Mexican friendship!
No one can stand the might of socialist cooperation!
The Americans have refused our ultimatum

The stubborn Americans have declined our ultimatum and decided to continue their war against Mexico. Now, we must stand firm to our word and plan for an intervention in favour of Mexico. Now that the German Empire in Europe is no more, we can divert a good part of our men and resources across the Atlantic for such an operation, and even invite Mexico into the Internationale - not to mention that Mexico would serve as another staging point for actions against the Entente!
Approach the Mexicans and offer them an alliance
On a second thought, we can't risk conflict across the Atlantic
A Frenco-Mexican Alliance?

The Commune of France is watching with great concern the current Mexican-American war. After they attempted ultimatum against American forces currently attacking our territory has failed, they now have approached our government with an offer for an alliance. Mexico would be admitted into the Internationale, which would mean that all other socialist powers would send us resources and forces which would help us end the American menace once and for all.
This alliance is the only chance for our survival
We don't want to get involved in European affairs
The fate of Las Vegas
Re-open the casinos, we could use the money
Gambling and vice have no place in our socialist nation

Emiliano Zapata, former president and hero of the Revolution
Luis Napoleon Morones, the Totalist union leader
Vicente Lombardo Toledano, the dean of Mexican Marxism
The death of Pancho Villa
Such a pity!
The death of Emiliano Zapata
Amalia Gonzбlez Caballero, the feminist pioneer
Luis Napoleon Morones, the Totalist union leader
Vicente Lombardo Toledano, the dean of Mexican Marxism
The death of Emiliano Zapata
Such terrible news indeed...
The death of Plutarco Elias Calles

Our dear president Plutarco Elias Calles, one of the main exponents of Totalism in Mexico, passed away today of old age. As the Mexican political system doesn't have a post of vice-president, our next leader must be selected by the Senate. Who shall be our next president?
Emiliano Zapata, former president and hero of the Revolution
Luis Napoleon Morones, the Totalist union leader
Vicente Lombardo Toledano, the dean of Mexican Marxism
The death of Plutarco Elias Calles
Plutarco Elias Calles, one of the main exponents of Totalism in Mexico, passed away today of old age.
May he rest in peace. Or something like that.
The Provinces relations with Panama

We have always been on good terms with Panama, our neighbor to the south. Now, with an increasingly belligerent Colombia to the south, and an expansionist Centroamerica to the northwest, it may be time to band together with Panama, to ensure we both survive.
Send an Alliance Proposition to Panama
The Provinces Are Better Off Without Panama!
The Provinces Propose an Alliance

The United Provinces have proposed a formal alliance between our two countries. With Colombia increasing the size of their armed forces, it may be time to ally with the Provinces. We need them now more than ever.
column9: Соединенные Провинции предложили нам заключить официальный союз между двумя странами. Поскольку Колумбия проводит экспансионистскую политику, предложение от Провинций пришло весьма вовремя, поскольку мы нуждаемся в их поддержке как никогда ранее.

column2: Now, we stand back to back with the United Provinces
column9: Теперь Соединенные Провинции прикроют нам спину

column2: We Must Turn Them Down...
Panama Accepts our Proposal
The Government of Panama has agreed to our alliance proposal, now we can sleep safer at night, with less of a threat coming from the radicals in Centroamerica or the imperialists in Colombia.
column9: Правительство Панамы приняло наше предложение и теперь мы можем спать спокойно, ведь радикалы из Центроамерики и колумбийские империалисты теперь не так опасны для нас.

column2: Great!
Spreading syndicalism in Central America

Weakinening influence of the USA on Central America, is presenting us with an unique opportunity to spready syndicalism into strategically important Panama. President of Panama Harmodio Madrid, despite his popularity, has made quite few enemies and we can perhaps support them to permanently silence him. Once current president of Panama is no more, we should be able to use chaos in country to gain full control over it.
Secretly nurture syndicalist movement in Panama
There are some things that just shouldn't be tried...
The Assassination of President Madrid

Our beloved President has been killed by a Syndicalist gunman. Panama City has collapsed into rioting and Syndicalist militias, probably funded by Centroamerica, are attempting to take over the country.
Awful!
The government of Panama Collapses

After the assassination of President Madrid, Panama collapsed into battles between Left-Wing guerillas and government forces. We must secure Panama before the chaos spreads across our borders! The United States, which are attempting to halt spreading of syndicalism in Central America have promised us their support in this matter.
Occupy Panama, we must bring an end to the chaos
column9: Оккупировать Панаму, мы должны положить конец этому хаосу

column2: We musn't interfere
UP troops enter Panama City
Troops from the United Provinces have entered our state to help us maintain order in protect our nation from syndicalist menace.
Join with the United Provinces to maintain order in Panama
column9: Стать частью Соединенных Провинций для поддержания порядка в Панаме

column2: We'll fight the occupation!
Panama joins the United Provinces
column9: Панама входит в состав Соединенных Провинций

column2: Rather than fall to syndicalism, Panama has decided to become a part of the United Provinces.
Excellent
Syndicalist Revolution!

After death of president Madrid events in Panama have reached the boiling point, and socialists have stormed the capital with Centroamerican equipment and volunteers and are attempting to install socialist government !
The government falls!
The Socialists are crushed!
Panama sues for peace

Armed forces of the United provinces have launched successfully invasion of Panama. Defeated remnants of the Panamanian armed forces have retread to their capital while political leaderships begs us for peace. How shall we react ?
column9: Вооруженные силы Соединенных Провинций успешно вторглись в Панаму. Остатки панамских войск бегут, а их правительство умоляет о мире.

column2: Integrate them directly !
They may exist. Under supervision..
Chaos in Panama

Yesterday, President Harmodio Madrid of Panama was assassinated by a syndicalist. Reports from our agents in the Canal Zone indicate that the country is in the midst of a syndicalist revolution, the success of which would put both the Canal and our interests in Central America in great jeopardy. The UPCA army is being mobilized and President Sacasa is prepared to send them in to stop the reds.
Give UPAC the green light.
No ! Violence wont solve anything.
Panama is secure!
Our effort and influence prevented another syndicalist revolution in Panama, which threatened strategically important Panama canal.
Phew!
Syndicalist revolution in Panama!

Despite our best effort, the syndicalist with help from Centroamerica took control over Panama ! Even the strategically important Panama canal is now under threat of potential syndicalist infiltration.
Damn it all!
Argentine settlers in Paraguay

During the Platinean occupation, thousands of Argentines were settled in our frontiers, founding many new farms and villages. With our independence regained, however, we could very well seize those lands and redistribute them amongst our own people! However, such populist move could harm our fragile economy, as a good part of our agriculture production comes from these farms.
Seize the farms and expell the Argentines
column9: Отобрать фермы у аргентинцев и депортировать их

column2: Those settlers are important for our economy
column9: Эти поселенцы имеют важное значение для нашей экономики

column2: Refugees from Paraguay
During the Platinean occupation, thousands of Argentine settlers moved to Paraguay. Their newly-independent government has decided to expell them...
column9: Во время ла-платской оккупации тысячи аргентинцев поселились в Парагвае. Вновь созданное правительство этой страны приняло решение депортировать их.

column2: Oh!
Presidential Elections of 1945

Since we have been granted autonomy, the people were longing for finally electing their President. Three main parties are disputing: First, we have the conservative National Republican Association (Asociaciуn Nacional Republicana), better known as the Partido Colorado, under Juan Manuel Frutos. Next, the liberal Partido Azul, represented by Josй Patricio Guggiari. And finally, the social-democratic Liga Nacional Independiente, with Rafael Franco.
Juan Manuel Frutos, Partido Colorado
Josй Patricio Guggiari, Partido Azul
Rafael Franco, Liga Nacional Independiente
Presidential Elections of 1950

Time for our second presidential election since our autonomy was restored. Once again, three main parties are disputing: the conservative Partido Colorado under Juan Natalicio Gonzбles, the liberal Partido Azul, represented by Luis Alberto Riart, and the social-democratic Liga Nacional Independiente, with Juan Stefanich.
Juan Natalicio Gonzбles, Partido Colorado
Luis Alberto Riart, Partido Azul
Juan Stefanich, Liga Nacional Independiente
Presidential Elections of 1955

Time for our third presidential election. Three main parties are disputing: the conservative Partido Colorado under Felipe Molas Lуpez, the liberal Partido Azul, represented by Felix Paiva, and the social-democratic Liga Nacional Independiente, with Anselmo Jover Peralta.
Felipe Molas Lуpez, Partido Colorado
Felix Paiva, Partido Azul
Anselmo Jover Peralta, Liga Nacional Independiente
Presidential Elections of 1960

Once again ,election time. As always, three main parties are disputing: the conservative Partido Colorado under Tomбs Romero Pereira, the liberal Partido Azul, represented by Carlos Pastore, and the social-democratic Liga Nacional Independiente, with Arnaldo Valdovinos.
Tomбs Romero Pereira, Partido Colorado
Carlos Pastore, Partido Azul
Arnaldo Valdovinos, Liga Nacional Independiente
Berlin Crisis hits the Andes

With the fall of the Berlin Stock Exchange, the economies of the South America have been hit hard. In order to mitigate some of the most harmfull efects, our leading economists have proposed a conference with the Bolivian government, in order to facilitate the entrance of our goods into their markets.
Propose a summit to the Bolivians
We are not interested
Conference with Peru

Leading Peruvian economists have proposed that we establish a more favorable entrance of their goods into the Bolivian markets. We could get some money from this, but the people would surelly complain as our own products would suffer with foreign concorrence.
Accept the Peruvian proposal
We are not interested in this
A customs union?

Our current relationship with Bolivia has been quite satisfactory. Thanks to their decision of taking a more market-oriented approach after our summit in 1936, our industrial production has flooded their markets with Peruvian goods. Bolivia and her people also benefited from this, of course. Now, however, some economists want to promote a customs union and common market between our two countries, removing any existing protectionist barriers.
Sounds like a good idea
We are not interested
Peru proposes a customs union

The 1936 economical summit with Peru resulted in some modernization of the Bolivian economy. Despite the initial flooding of foreign products into our markets, soon Bolivia started to receive its profits, as our agricultural and mineral produce entered Peru more easily. Now, the government in Lima wants to promote a customs union and common market between our two countries, removing any existing protectionist barriers. Should we accept their offer?
Establish the Andean Common Market
This cooperation was a terrible mistake
Treaty of Friendship?

The Andean Common Market between Peru and Bolivia has proved a success! Never have our two countries been so rich and prosperous! Now, with South America a volatile continent, some politicians have proposed adding a common defensive pact to our string of treaties: an attack against one country would be considered a direct agression against the other...
Propose this to Bolivia
We are not interested
Peru proposes a defense pact

The Andean Common Market between Peru and Bolivia has proved a success! Never have our two countries been so rich and prosperous! Now, with South America a volatile continent, some Peruvian politicians have proposed adding a common defensive pact to our string of treaties: an attack against one country would be considered a direct agression against the other...
Sign the deal!
What a dumb idea!
The end of Peru-Bolivian cooperation
Due to the present state of war between Peru and Bolivia, all joint projects between our two countries have been canceled.
column9: Из-за войны между Перу и Боливией были отменены все совместные проекты наших стран.

column2: Such a pity!
Union between Bolivia and Peru?

Seeing the dramatical fiscal and geopolitical situation in the South America with Brazil and Argentina rising as new threats on horizont we need to reconsider the peaceful option of uniting both nations. It would prevent Bolivia falling into Syndicalism and bring us greener lands.
Propose union
Propose alliance
It's pointless
Reestablishment of the Confederation

After nearly a century of seperation the two nations of Peru and Bolivia has once again united in their common struggle! Long live the Peru-Bolivian Confederation. May we be the light of South America!
column9: После почти столетнего разделения народов Перу и Боливии мы объединились вновь! Да здравствует Конфедерация Перу и Боливии!

column2: Revival of the Confederation!
Peru-Bolivian Claims on the Amazon Basin
The Amazon Basin, a widely contested region is divided up among five of our neighbors, all who refuse to recognize our rightful claim on the basin.
The Amazon Basin is, and has been Rightfully Ours!
We are content with these boundaries, for now
The 1939 Presidental election

It is time for the next Presidential election. The two parties that have a chance at winning are either the Conservative party or the Patriotic Front. The Social Democrat party, because of their connection to the assassination of Luis Miguel Sбnchez Cerro, the previous president, have been barred from the election...
The Conservatives win it!
The Patriotic Front win it!
The army shall put an end to this chaotic democracy!
The 1944 Presidental election
It is time for the next Presidential election. The Social Democrat is back on the ballot and the Conservatives have agreed to a coalition with the Patriotic Front, who will win?
column9: Настало время для следующих президентских выборов. Социал-демократы вернулись на выборы а консерваторы согласились создать коалицию с Патриотическим фронтом. Кто победит?
