Revolution in Bolivia!

The rightfull government of the Republic of Bolivia has been overthrown by syndicalist bands! Already their president has seeked asylum in their neighbor La Plata. We must find a way to prevent this rebellion from spreading towards us. Our military leaders have suggested increasing our presence in the border areas.
Raise new infantry division in the area
Do nothing, they can't harm us
Elections of 1946

Since we've been granted autonomy, the people of the Piratinн Republic have been expecting the day they'd finally choose their president. And this is it! Three main parties are disputing the votes: the more hardline-conservative Partido Conservador under Irineu Bornhausen and Mбrio Gomes da Silva, the traditional Partido Republicano with Affonso Camargo and Caetano Munhoz da Rocha, and the liberal Partido Federal with Clotбrio Portugal and Vespasiano Barbosa Martins
Partido Conservador - Bornhausen and Gomes da Silva
Partido Republicano - Camargo and Munhoz da Rocha
Partido Federal - Clotбrio Portugal and Barbosa Martins
Elections of 1952

After six years, the Republic will have another presidential election. Once again, three main parties are disputing the votes: the hardline Partido Conservador under Ramiro Noronha and Irineu Bornhausen, the traditional Partido Republicano with Walter Peracchi Barcelos and Adolfo Konder, and the liberal Partido Federal with Vespasiano Barbosa Martins and Joгo Alexandre Busse.
Partido Conservador - Noronha and Bornhausen
Partido Republicano - Barcelos and Konder
Partido Federal - Martins and Busse
Elections of 1958

Six more years have passed, and the Republic will have another presidential election. Once again, three main parties are disputing the votes: the hardline Partido Conservador under Mбrio Gomes da Silva and Ramiro Noronha, the traditional Partido Republicano with Dagoberto Dulcнdio Pereira and Antфnio Augusto Chaves, and the liberal Partido Federal with Nereu Ramos and Valmor Ribeiro Branco.
Partido Conservador - Gomes da Silva and Noronha
Partido Republicano - Pereira and Chaves
Partido Federal - Ramos and Ribeiro Branco
Elections of 1964

Once again, elections in the Republic, with three main parties disputing the votes: the hardline Partido Conservador under Mбrio Gomes da Silva and Ramiro Noronha, the traditional Partido Republicano with Antфnio Augusto Chaves and Aristiliano Ramos, and the liberal Partido Federal with Joгo Alexandre Busse and Nereu Ramos.
Partido Conservador - Gomes da Silva and Noronha
Partido Republicano - Chaves and Aristiliano Ramos
Partido Federal - Busse and Nereu Ramos
Sudamerika

For the past several years, we have been building a friendship with La Plata with hopes that one day they will dominate South America, but that day will never come if they do not have the proper military. We can offer them a helping hand by sending volunteers, specialists and blueprints if we are willing.
Send La Plata Military Aid!
La Plata is on its Own!
German Aid
Our German friends have sent assistance, to maintain our hegemonic position in South America.
Ok
Germany Turns its Back
Our fairweather German friends have declined to assist us.
Ok
Relations with Chile
Chile has been our trade partner and friend for many years. Now with the threat of Syndicalism, it's been proposed that we either form an alliance with them or at least guarantee their independence.
column9: Чили является нашим торговым партнером и другом уже долгие годы. В связи с угрозой синдикализма, нам стоит заключить союз, или по крайней мере, гарантировать их независимость.

column2: Propose an alliance to them
Guarantee their independence, but nothing more
Cooperation with Chile is of no interest to us
column9: Сотрудничество с Чили не представляет никакого интереса для нас

column2: La Plata guarantees our independence

On a short diplomatic note today, the Union of La Plata has announced that, in face of the present syndicalist menace on the continent, they will now consider any attack against Chile as an act of agression against themselves. Should we extend the gratitude?
Together we will defend ourselves against the left
column9: Вместе мы сможем защитить себя от левой угрозы

column2: We'd rather remain neutral on the matter
Chile denies our offer
The Republic of Chile refused to comply to their part of the deal! How should we react?
column9: Республика Чили отказалась выполнить свою часть сделки! Как мы должны реагировать?

column2: We will keep guaranteeing their independence anyway
column9: Мы будем гарантировать их независимость в любом случае

column2: They will see it one day!
An offer from La Plata
La Plata has proposed an alliance be formed, an Axis of anti-Syndicalist countries. What should we tell them?
column9: Ла-Плата предложила союз - ось антисиндикалистских стран. Что мы ответим?

column2: We must fight the left together!
column9: Мы должны бороться с левыми вместе!

column2: Refuse their alliance, we value our neutrality!
column9: Отказаться от союза, мы ценим нейтралитет

column2: The Buenos Aires-Santiago Axis is formed
Chile has accepted our offer and the Buenos Aires-Santiago Axis has been created!
column9: Чили приняло наше предложение. Ось Буэнос-Айрес — Сантьяго - официально создана!

column2: This day will go down in history!
Chile has rejected our offer
Chile has refused to fight alongside us in the future, making them a potential liability.
column9: Чили отказалось воевать вместе с нами, что в будущем делает его потенциально опасными.

column2: Chile would not stab us in the back, leave them be
column9: Чили не ударит нам в спину, оставим их

column2: They will just see it, one day
An alliance with La Plata ?

With syndicalism on rise in Southern America Peru must protect itself against this menace.Currently the most dangerous enemies of our state are definitively Brazilian and Bolivian states, both dominated by syndicalism. We can protect ourselves by joining arms with ideologically similar La-Platan state.
Propose an Alliance with La Plata
Rather not
The Buenos Aires-Lima Axis
Peru has proposed an axis be formed, a defensive alliance between Argentina and Peru against syndicalist menace. What should we tell them?
column9: Перу предлагает нам заключить союз против синдикалистской угрозы. Что мы ответим?

column2: La Plata and Peru, we must fight the left together!
Refuse their alliance, we don't need them!
An alliance with La Plata ?

Newly born Confederation of Peru and Bolivia had many potential enemies. The most dangerous enemy of our state is definitively Brazilian state, dominated by syndicalism. We can protect ourselves by joining arms with ideologically similar La-Platan state.
column9: Недавно провозглашенная Конфедерация Перу и Боливии имеет немало врагов. Самый опасный из них - Бразилия, управляемая синдикалистами. Мы можем защитить себя, объединив усилия с идеологически близкой нам Ла-Платой.

column2: Propose an Alliance with La-Plata
Rather not
The Buenos Aires-Lima Axis
Confederacy of Peru and Bolivia has proposed an axis be formed, a defensive alliance between Argentina and Confederacy against syndicalist menace. What should we tell them?
column9: Конфедерация Перу и Боливии предлагает заключить союз против синдикалистской угрозы. Что мы ответим?

column2: La Plata and Confederation, we must fight the left together!
Refuse their alliance, we don't need anyone!
column9: Отклонить их предложение, нам никто не нужен!

column2: Alliance for better future?

Peru has aggresive tendencies, and its neighbours are frightened about next war with them. Ecuador might be the best country to sign with them an alliance treaty. Ecuador feels threatened by Peru and seeks help.
Ask Ecuador
It's worthless
Colombia proposes an alliance?
Colombians seeing the nervous atmosphere between us and Peru decided to sign an alliance. What is our opinion?
Sign it!
Reject offer
Alliance with Venezuela?
Our alliance with Ecuador has helped bring stability to the region. However, it has been proposed that we expand our alliance to also include Venezeula and in way recreate Gran Columbia.
Send mission to Caracas
It's pointless
Colombia proposes an alliance
The Colombians have sent us an offer to ally with them and the Ecudorians want to sign alliance with us. How we should respond?
Sign
Reject it
Improvements on the southern borders

Since we feel La Plata will be our future enemy, it would be wise to improve our defences on our borders. Our top military leaders have suggested a new network of forts streching from Rio Grande do Sul to Mato Grosso.
column9: Скорее всего в будущем Ла-Плата станет нашим врагом, поэтому имеет смысл улучшить укрепления на южной границе. Наши военные предложили новую сеть укреплений от Риу-Гранди-ду-Сул до Мату-Гросу.

column2: Build the forts
That is not necessary
Brazilian build-up
The Brazilian Army is amassing troops and constructing new forts on their borders with La Plata. This is clearly a sign of preparation for an invasion! How should we respond?
column9: Бразильская армия накапливает войска и строит новые форты на границе с Ла-Платой. Это явно знак подготовки к вторжению! Как мы отреагируем?

column2: Set up more forts in the border areas
Send more men and increase border patrols
We must avoid a buildup in the region
Brazilian and Platinean patrols exchange fire!
column9: Бразильский и ла-платский патруль обстреляли друг друга!

column2: A Brazilian patrol has just come under fire from a Platinean unit on the border area near Santana do Livramento, by the old Uruguayan border. At 7 am this morning, gunshots were heard from both sides of the border, in an incident that resulted in five deaths in both sides. The local base commander has assured us that the Argentinians fired first! With tensions between Brazil and La Plata on the rise, this could very well become the starting point of a war!
They fired first! Demand a full apology!
column9: Они открыли огонь первыми! Требовать извинений!

column2: This was our fault, send them a note
column9: Это наша вина, принести им извинения

column2: Brazilian and Platinean patrols exchange fire!
column9: Бразильский и ла-платский патруль обстреляли друг друга!

column2: A Platinean patrol has just come under fire from a Brazilian unit on the border area near Rivera, Uruguay. At 7 am this morning, gunshots were heard from both sides of the border, in an inccident that resulted in five deaths in both sides. Even though our local commander has assured us that the Brazilians fired first, we have just received a note from the Brazilian diplomats in Buenos Aires stating that their troops only fired after they were attacked by our men!
Send formal apology!
This is an outrage! Ready the troops!
Brazilian and Platinean patrols exchange fire!
column9: Бразильский и ла-платский патруль обстреляли друг друга!

column2: A Platinean patrol has just come under fire from a Brazilian unit on the border area near Rivera, Uruguay. At 7 am this morning, gunshots were heard from both sides of the border, in an inccident that resulted in five deaths in both sides. Our local commander has assured us that the Brazilians fired first, and we have just received a note from the Brazilian diplomats in Buenos Aires indeed confirming that their troops fired the first rounds 'by accident after a misunderstanding'...
Accept their apologies
Apologies are not enough! Demand compensation!
This was a delibearate act of agression! Ready the troops!
column9: Это был преднамеренный акт агрессии! Готовьте войска!

column2: Platineans recognized their fault
We were just told that the Platineans recognized that their own men started the skirmish in Santana do Livramento early this morning. They also issued a diplomatic note apologizing for the incident!
column9: Ла-платцы признали свою вину в инциденте. Они также отправили дипломатическую ноту с извинениями!

column2: Accept their apologies
Apologies are not enough! Demand compensation!
La Plata demands compensation
After we assumed our fault for the incident in Santana do Livramento, the Platineans have demanded a full compensation!
column9: После того, как мы признали нашу вину в инциденте, ла-платцы потребовали компенсации!

column2: We must buy our peace
Refuse outright!
The Platineans mobilize!
Our patrols and intelligence officers have stated that the Platinean army is mobilized and expecting their orders for an attack against us!
column9: Патрули и разведка заявляют, что ла-платская армия мобилизована и ожидает приказа о начале нападения на нас!

column2: Pull back and negotiate a cease-fire
column9: Отступить и начать переговоры о прекращении огня

column2: This means war!
Brazil demands compensation
After we assumed our fault for the incident in Rivera, the Brazilians have demanded a full compensation!
column9: После того как мы взяли на себя вину за инцидент в Ривере, бразильцы потребовали компенсацию.

column2: We have no choice but to comply
Refuse!
La Plata Refuses!
The Platineans have refused our demand for compensation. How should we react? Are we ready for a war with them?
column9: Ла-платцы отклонили наше требование о компенсации. Как мы отреагируем? Готовы ли мы к войне с ними?

column2: We can't force them
So this means war!
La Plata accepts
The Platineans have accepted our demand for compensation.
column9: Ла-платцы приняли наше требование о компенсации

column2: Good
Brazil Refuses!
The Brazilians have refused our demand for compensation. How should we react? Are we ready for a war with them?
column9: Бразильцы отказались выполнить наше требование о компенсации. Как мы отреагируем? Готовы ли мы к войне с ними?

column2: We can't force them
So this means war!
Brazil accepts
The Brazilians have accepted our demand for compensation.
column9: Бразильцы приняли наше требование о компенсации.

column2: Good
Brazil wants a cease-fire

The Brazilians are apparently backing down from their positions in the border and have offered a cease-fire. Should we accept? A good part of our public wants revenge for the fallen soldiers of Rivera, though.
column9: Бразильцы отступили от своих позиций на границе и предложили прекращение огня. Должны ли мы принять его, учитывая что, значительная часть нашего общества хочет отомстить за павших солдат в Ривере?

column2: Accept their proposal, we are not ready for war just yet
column9: Принять их предложение, мы пока не готовы к войне

column2: Refuse! They will pay for their agression!
column9: Отказать! Они заплатят за свою агрессию!

column2: Lessons from the crisis

Last month's skirmish against the Platineans have really scared us. We were caught unprepared and left on the brink of war! Our government thinks that it is only a matter of time before La Plata turns against us once again - and next time, their response will surely be different.
They will come after us eventually, we must be prepared
We must demobilize to avoid further escalation
column9: Демобилизовать армию, чтобы избежать эскалации конфликта

column2: Border Skirmish in Uruguaiana!

We have just received a report that Brazilian and Platinean troops have exchanged fire inside our own borders! An Uruguayan wanted criminal (an anti-Platinean independence fighter, probably!)  crossed the border into Brazil and, despite repeated warnings, a Platinean patrol entered our country to aprehend him. A gunfight ensued on the outskirts of Uruguaiana, Rio Grande do Sul, leaving twelve deaths on both sides.
This means war!
Step down, show them the white flag!
Border skirmish in northwest Uruguay!

We have just received a report that Brazilian and Platinean troops have exchanged fire! An Uruguayan wanted criminal crossed the border into Brazil, being followed by a Platinean patrol. Despite our repeated warnings towards the Brazilian units, a gunfight ensued on the outskirts of Uruguaiana, Rio Grande do Sul, leaving twelve deaths on both sides. Our intelligence reports that the Brazilians are considering this an act of war!
We will show them! Attack!
Step down, show them the white flag!
Border skirmish in northwest Uruguay!

We have just received a report that Brazilian and Platinean troops have exchanged fire! An Uruguayan wanted criminal crossed the border into Brazil, being followed by a Platinean patrol. Despite our repeated warnings towards the Brazilian units, a gunfight ensued on the outskirts of Uruguaiana, Rio Grande do Sul, leaving twelve deaths on both sides. Our intelligence reports, however, that the Brazilians are willing to call a cease fire to avoid an escalation.
This wont be unresponded - Declare war!
Accept their offer - Peace in our time!
column9: Принять их предложение - Мир для нашего времени!

column2: La Plata offers a cease-fire
La Plata has showed us the white flag in hopes we will demobilize our forces and avoid a war. How shall we respond?
column9: Ла-Плата подняла белый флаг в надежде, что мы демобилизуем наши силы и прекратим подготовку к войне. Как нам реагировать?

column2: Refuse! This is war!
Good! Peace in our time!
Rio de Janiero has been captured!
The capital of Brazil has fallen. Rio is now in our hands and the government has fled to the North, to Recife.
Great News!
Brazil captures Buenos Aires
The capital and seat of La Plata's government, Buenos Aires and has been captured by the Brazilian Army. Local resistance is currently being put down, and the city should soon be stabilized.
Great News!
Victory over Brazil
The armed forces of La Plata have won a crushing victory over their historic Brazilian foes.  Shall we dictate terms to the Brazilians, or continue the war to absolute victory?
column9: Наши вооруженные силы одержали сокрушительную победу над Бразилией! Мы можем либо продиктовать ей свои условия, либо продолжить войну до полной победы

column2: Demand the Brazilian Southwest
Demand the Brazilian Southwest and Impose a Friendly Government
column9: Потребовать юго-восток Бразилии и навязать дружественное правительство

column2: Just impose a Friendly Government
Continue with war !
The Peace Demands of La Plata

With much of the country occupied, La Plata has informed our government of the terms they wish to impose on us.  In exchange for peace, they demand the transfer of the southwestern Brazil under their control.  Shall we accept their terms, or continue the war?
Accept the Terms
Reject the Terms
Brazil Accepts Our Peace Terms
Brazil has accepted our peace terms, and transferred their southwestern provinces under our control.  This is a great day for La Plata!
column9: Бразилия приняла наши условия мира и передала нам свои южные провинции. Это великий день для Ла-Платы!

column2: Glorious
Brazil Rejects Our Peace Terms
Brazil has rejected our generous peace terms, and so the war will continue.
column9: Бразилия отклонила наши щедрые условия мира, поэтому война будет продолжена.

column2: They will suffer
The Peace Demands of La Plata

With much of the country occupied, La Plata has informed our government of the terms they wish to impose on us.  In exchange for peace, they demand the transfer of the southwestern Brazil under their control.  Shall we accept their terms, or continue the war?
Accept the Terms
Reject the Terms
Brazil Accepts Our Peace Terms
Brazil has accepted all our demands and reformed their governments to our liking.  This is a great day for La Plata!
column9: Бразилия согласилась на все требования и реформировала правительство по нашему усмотрению. Это великий день для Ла-Платы!

column2: Glorious
A friendly cabinet in Brazil
As part of our peace demands, we must choose the new government of Brazil. Will we keep them under a harsh military dictatorship, or will we grant them a loyal, civilian government?
Leave them under a civilian government
Setup a military cabinet
Brazil Rejects Our Peace Terms
Brazil has rejected our generous peace terms, and so the war will continue.
column9: Бразилия отклонила наши щедрые условия мира, поэтому война будет продолжена.

column2: They will suffer
The Peace Demands of La Plata

With much of the country occupied, La Plata has informed our government of the terms they wish to impose on us.  In exchange for peace, they demand the transfer of the southwestern Brazil under their control, and the formation of a new government friendly to La Plata.  Shall we accept their terms, or continue the war?
Accept the Terms
Reject the Terms
Brazil Accepts Our Peace Terms
Brazil has accepted our peace terms, transferred their southwestern provinces under our control, and agreed to form a new government friendly to La Plata.  This is a great day for La Plata!
Glorious
Brazil Rejects Our Peace Terms
Brazil has rejected our generous peace terms, and so the war will continue.
column9: Бразилия отклонила наши щедрые условия мира, поэтому война будет продолжена.

column2: They will suffer
Peace with Bolivia?
Our war with Bolivia is ongoing. Should we demand the surrender of their government, just the disputed territories, or do we continue the war until the end?
column9: Сейчас мы воюем с Боливией. Должны ли мы заставить их правительство вернуть наши национальные земли, или же будем вести войну до конца?

column2: Demand the Chaco and a loyal government
column9: Потребовать Чако и установления лояльного правительства

column2: We just want the disputed areas
Continue until total victory
La Plata demands our surrender

The Guayana Question

As the Caribbean Federation has severed its pact with the Entente, we must now take the chance to bring the Guayana Question to the table. Due to several treaties between Spain and Netherlands since the XVII Century, Venezuela has a legal claim to all territory west of the Essequibo River - which we call the 'Guayana Essequiba'. This claim, however, was never recognized by the British. When the Federation was formed in 1926, they kept hold of the disputed territory, despite our protests.

As our country has severed its pact with the Entente, Venezuela took the chance to bring the Guayana Question to the table. Venezuela claims to have rights to all territory west of the Essequibo River - which they call the 'Guayana Essequiba' region. This claim, however, was never recognized by the British. The treacherous government of Caracas has decided to use this moment to press their claims. What should we do now?
Guyana Essequiba is forever our territory
Perhaps we could make a deal and sell the land to them
We must avoid any possible conflict, surrender the disputed areas
A proposal from the Federation

As we presented the Caribbean Federation with our claims to the disputed territory of Guayana Essequiba, they have come up with a counter-proposal: They are willing to hand us over the region, in exchange for a payment in capital and raw materials. Should we accept their offer?
It's a nice deal, accept it
Why would we have to pay for it? This is OUR land!
Forget the whole matter, this may get too dangerous
Venezuela Accepts
The Republic of Venezuela has accepted our offer. In exchange for the disputed Guayana Essequiba region, we will receive a payment in capital and raw materials.
It was a nice deal, I guess... Anyway, crisis averted!
Guayana Essequiba is ours!
The Caribbean Federation has transfered the disputed territory of Guayana Essequiba to Venezuela.
Amazing!
The Federation refuses
The stubborn Caribbean Federation has refused to comply to our demands and have insisted that Guyana Essequiba is a part of their febble country. What should we do, now?
Threaten them with war
Forget this, we're not ready for action yet
Venezuela has threatened us

The Republic of Venezuela has threatned our dear Federation with a war if we don't cede to their demands. What should we do now? Maybe it would be wise to cede them the disputed territory in order to avoid a conflict which could simply destroy of nation.
We are prepared for any conflict, let them come
We must avoid conflict, surrender the disputed areas
War with the Federation?

The Caribbean Federation has ignored all our threats and demands for our rightfull territory of Guayana Essequiba. There's only one answer to this, now: War! Our troops are already moving towards the disputed areas, just awaiting Presidential orders to proceed with the intervention.
Attack!
Back down, we're not ready for action just yet!
Venezuela upholds their demands
The Venezuelan government has insisted on their claims. They refuse to pay for what they consider their 'rightfull territory', and insist that we must hand them the disputed lands immediatly.
Our land is our land!
We must avoid conflict, surrender the disputed areas
Caribbean-Venezuelan War!

Venezuelan troops have started crossing the border into the disputed territory of Guayana Essequiba! With our capital, Georgetown, within close reach of their armies, we must move our cabinet elsewhere, now.
Move our capital to nearby Trinidad
Flee to Montserrat, on the Eastern Caribbean
Move our capital to our biggest island, Jamaica
The farthest, the safest - move to Bermuda
Guyana Essequiba under our control

We have achieved our primary objective in this war: our troops have completelly occupied the disputed area of Guayana Essquiba. This may be the time to send envoys to the Federation in order to end this conflict. A small part of our officers, however, believe that we should continue until we enforce a humiliating defeat on the Caribbeans!
Send the envoys
Continue this war
Venezuelan envoys

As we have lost the western bank of the Essequibo river and with Georgetown threatned, the Venezuelan government has sent a diplomatic misson towards our capital. They wish to end this war if we recognize their demands.
No! This war must go on!
We must end this conflict, surrender the disputed areas
We are losing the war!

Disaster has struck us: Not only we haven't managed to occupy the disputed lands of Guayana Essequiba, but the Caribbean Federation has succeded on seizing large areas of our own territory. We must now find a way out of this mess...
Send the envoys, we must end this war!
We must continue this war until we're marching on their lands!
Venezuela has been defeated
As we managed to occupy large areas of Venezuela, their government has sent a diplomatic misson towards our capital. They wish to end this war.
No! This war must go on!
Sure! Victory is ours!
Venezuelan Expansionism

After our victory over the Caribbean Federation, on which we regained the disputed territory of Guayana Essequiba, irredentist thoughts have surfaced amongst the Venezuelan public, political classes and the military. The most often cited targets for Venezuelan expansion are the Dutch colonies of Aruba, Bonaire and Curaзao - which were Spanish territory administered from Caracas from 1527 to 1634 - and the islands of Trinidad and Tobago - also part of the old Viceroyalty of Nueva Granada.
Yes, the Caribbean will be Venezuelan one day!
We have no interest to move on this direction
Returning to Georgetown
As the Caribbean-Venezuelan War has ended, it is now safe to move our cabinet back to Georgetown.
Yes, head back home
Actually, our new capital does have its charms
New Foreign Directions

For better or for worse, our war against Venezuela has ended. We now know that we have put much at risk by abandoning our commitment to the Entente Cordiale. With this in mind, some of our politicians have brought up the question of returning to the protection of our King in Canada and our old allies of the Empire.
Petition our return to the Entente
Our future lies elsewhere
The Federation and the Entente
Following the Caribbean-Venezuelan War, the Federation has realized the foolishness of their earlier abandonment of the Entente. They now wish to return to our fold. Should we accept them back?
Sure, welcome them back
No! Send them away!
The Future of the Federation

Some time ago, we declared that the future of our diplomacy lies not with the Entente, but elsewhere. We must now choose our new path. Would it be wise to align with the Colombian-led Andean Pact? Or it would be better to seek isolation?
Align with Colombia and their Andean Pact
Isolationism - We have our own internal matters to worry about
Partitions?
Now when whole Bolivia has fallen to our hands, we can partition it between us and our glorious allies or recreate it as independent state.
column9: Боливия находится под нашим полным контролем, мы можем разделить ее с нашими союзниками или же полностью аннексировать.

column2: Bolivia should never be reborn
Get the Santa Cruz and estabilish a puppet government
Occupy whole Bolivia. For now....
Partitioning of Bolivia - Peruvian spoils
Just as planned, our troops enter former capital of Bolivia, La Paz. Now fate of Bolivian citizens is in our hands
column9: Все идет по плану - наши войска заняли столицу Боливии, Ла-Пас.

column2: Great!

column9: Чили находится под нашим полным контролем, мы можем разделить ее с с Перу или же полностью аннексировать.

Chile should be never reborn!
Occupy whole Chile. For now....

Maintain Direct Rule
Bolivia and La Plata
La Plata has decided to restore Bolivian independence, provided it maintains a friendly government.
Ok
The Fate of Occupied Bolivia

Liberate Bolivia Entirely
Liberate Bolivia with a Friendly Government
Maintain Direct Rule

Ok

Ok

The Panama Canal

The current occupants of Panama canal are experiencing serious problems in war. This present us with opportunity to seize the strategically important Panama Canal for ourselves . There is very little that current occupants can do to stop us at this point.

column2: Seize the Panama canal !

Argentine settlers in Uruguay

During the Platinean occupation, thousands of Argentines were settled in our frontiers, founding many new farms and villages. However, such populist move could harm our fragile economy, as a good part of our agriculture production comes from these farms.
Seize the farms and expell the Argentines

Dissent

column2: Dissent turns into Revolt

A Mass Protest turned into an Angry Mob as the people came down from the barrios on the mountain side to protest and demand a new constitution that was voted against yesterday. Encouraged by the governments of Bolivia and Brasil, they have repeated the pattern and surrounded the Presidential Palace.
Give into their Demands!
Crush this Rebellion!
The New Government of Venezuela
Juna Bautista Fuenmayor forms his cabinet.

column2: Juan Bautista Fuenmayor and the Socialist Party!
Alliance with Brazil ?

The world is a dangerous place, so we need alliances with sworn enemies of the capitalism. Venezuela and Brazil could benefit from joining forces in a crusade for a new, brave world. Anti-socialist warmongers from La Plata are seeking war to crush the successful Brazilian and Venezuelan revolutions, so we need to combine our powers to defend the spoils of our proletarian uprisings!
Propose an Alliance with Brazil
Rather not
Alliance with Venezuela ?
Venezuela has proposed an axis be formed, a defensive alliance between Brazil and Venezuela against capitalist menace. What should we tell them?
column9: Венесуэла предлагает нам заключить оборонительный союз против капиталистической угрозы. Что мы ответим?

column2: Accept their offer !
Refuse their alliance, we don't need anyone!
column9: Отклонить их предложение, нам никто не нужен!

column2: The Venezuelan Oil Industry

Oil has always been a chief export of Venezula, as far back as we can remember. It has been proposed that we take the Oil Industry from the hands of foreign companies and sell the oil to them ourselves. Our profits would increase and we would have taken another step towards true independence and self dependence.
The Oil Refined Here is Ours, Nationalize!,
We would not want to upset foreign interests
column9: Это может помешать нашим внешнеполитическим интересам

column2: The 1941 Presidental election

While currently the President is elected by the Legislature, it's not any easier than a national election and therefore anyone can win. However, there is onyl two canidates in this election, either Isaнas Medina Angarita or the current President with the former likely going to win...
Isaнas Medina Angarita is our man!
column9: Нашим лидером станет Исайяс Медина Ангарита!

column2: The current President is fine
A day in Autumn

With Medina Angarita having been our President for some time now, his policies have increasling pleased no one. Because of this, critics of him have begun plotting a coup detat headed by Rуmulo Betancourt...
column9: Через некоторое время после избрания Исайяса Ангариты стало ясно, что его политика не устраивает никого. Критика в его адрес привела к подготовке переворота, возглавляемого Ромуло Бетанкуром...

column2: Rуmulo Betancourt takes over!
Medina Angarita continues to lead the nation
The 1947 Presidental election

This election will go down in Venezulan history because this is the first election the people directly elect the President! Because the Social Democrats forced this and other social reforms, they are viewed quite with high regard by the people and are likely to be the Christian Democrats...
The Social Democrats win it!
The Christian Democrats win it!
The 1954 Presidental election

It is time for the next Presidential election. The radicals of the Social Democrats, discontent with the relative moderation of the party, split and formed their own Syndicalist party. However, it is much more likely for the weakened Social Democrats or even the Christians to win...
The Social Democrats win it!
The Christian Democrats win it!
The Syndicalists win it!
The 1961 Presidental election
Wow... did you really play till 1961 as Venezula? Regardless, the three political parties all have essentially the same chance of winning...
column9: Ну надо же..., вы действительно доиграли до 1961 года за Венесуэлу? Несмотря на это, все те же политические партии имеют все те же шансы на победу...

column2: The Social Democrats win it!
The Christian Democrats win it!

Carlos Delgado Chalbaud has died!
Carlos Delgado Chalbaud, our President has died! A week of mourning has been declared and German Suarez Flamerich has become the interm President.
column9: Умер наш президент, Карлос Дельгадо Чальбауд! Объявлен недельный траур, исполняющим обязанности президента стал Херман Суарес Фламерич.
